info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 23 at 10:16AM EDT by NWS Marquette MI
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Marquette has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Michigan...
Michigamme River near Republic affecting Marquette County.
.Recent rainfall from Monday as well as snowmelt has led to river rises at the Michigamme River near Republic.
* WHAT...Elevated river levels caused by rain and snowmelt are occurring.
* WHERE...Michigamme River near Republic.
* WHEN...From this morning until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 7.7 feet, Water begins to impact the yards of homes near Bengtson bridge on County Road LI in South Republic At 10.0 feet, Portions of County Roads 601...LE and LG experience significant flooding
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:51 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 8.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.4 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 8.4 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette.
The next statement will be issued this evening by 2am EDT Thursday. late tonight at 230 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
